column1: The tendons of the rotator cuff pass underneath a bony area on their way to attaching to the top of the arm bone.
This helps keep the joint stable and allows the arm bone to move on the shoulder bone.

Injury to these tendons may result in: - Rotator cuff tendinitis, which is irritation and swelling of these tendons - A rotator cuff tear, which occurs when one of the tendons is torn due to overuse or injury These injuries often lead to pain, weakness, and stiffness when you use your shoulder.
